intro: Psychotria scitula, commonly known as the small psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. Psychotria scitula is often found in understory habitats of tropical forests, where it thrives in low light conditions.
